metadata.title: CVE-2019-15297 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
res_pjsip_t38 in Sangoma Asterisk 15.x before 15.7.4 and 16.x before 16.5.1allows an attacker to trigger a crash by sending a declined stream in aresponse to a T.38 re-invite initiated by Asterisk. The crash occursbecause of a NULL session media object dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15297` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-config - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mobile - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-modules - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mysql - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-tests - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-vpb - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.10.0~dfsg-1').
